c74object.name: bach.transcribe
c74object.digest: Fills a bach.roll according to incoming MIDI data
c74object.description: The purpose of bach.transcribe is to act as a machine which, when turned on, receives data containing cents, velocities and voice numbers (and optional durations), and properly adds in real time the notes in the connected bach.roll object.

inlet.digest: MIDI triplets/quadruplets in the form: cents, velocity, voice number; (optional) duration (ms)

method.name: allnotesoff
method.digest: Send note-off messages for all active notes
method.description: A allnotesoff message ends all notes currently being played, as if their note off MIDI triplets had been sent through the right inlet.

method.name: int
method.description: A 1 in the first inlet turns the transcription on: bach.transcribe clears the connected bach.roll (if any) and starts expecting the MIDI triplets from its second inlet, in order to add notes in the bach.roll. A 0 in the first inlet turns the transcription off (MIDI triplets in the second inlet no longer have any effect).

method.name: list
method.description:
A list in the second inlet is expected to be in the form of a MIDI triplet containing three integers: cents velocity voice_number. When velocity is strictly positive, this triplet represents a note, in the voice defined by the voice_number, which starts in the exact moment the triplet has been sent, and has the introduced cents as pitch. In this case, the appropriate messages to add a note are sent to the the possibly connected bach.roll. The note duration is regularly updated (see the refresh attribute), until a note-off event is received concerning the specific note. At any new received triplets or refreshing, the current time is also output from the second outlet, and the screen position is refreshed (see inscreenpos attribute). Note-off events are simply represented by triplet having velocity zero.
For instance, a triplet 6000 70 1 adds a middle C having velocity of 70 in the first voice. To turn such note off, you'll need to send a note-off triplet 6000 0 1.
If one more element is given in the third inlet (thus a MIDI quadruplet is input), such element is considered to be the duration of the note in milliseconds. For such note, there will be no need to send any note-off: the note is simply added with its complete duration as soon as the quadruplet is entered.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in the bach.roll gathered syntax in the second inlet will be considered as a whole roll to be transcribed.

attribute.name: autoclear
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to automatically clear the bach.roll connected to the first outlet whenever a transcription starts. By default it is on.

attribute.name: inscreenpos
attribute.digest: Current Instant Relative Position In Domain
attribute.description: When new MIDI data arrive in the third inlet or when a refresh operation is performed (see refresh attribute), the horizontal scrollbar position of the connected bach.roll (if any and if its horizontal scrollbar is visible) is changed in order for the "current instant" to be at a certain point inside the notation object domain. This point is a number between 0. and 1. defined by this attribute, 0. meaning: at the beginning of the displayed portion of score, and 1. meaning: at the end of the displayed portion of score. (This is the very same parameter that one encounters with bach.roll's inscreenpos message.) Defaults to 0.7.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Current Instant Relative Position In Domain

attribute.name: play
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to also play the transcribed content (with a delay set via the playdelay attribute). By default it is off.

attribute.name: playdelay
attribute.description: If play is on, sets the delay between the writing cursor and the playing cursor, i.e. the delay before play starts. Defaults to 250ms.

attribute.name: refresh
attribute.description: Sets the refresh time, for the note durations, in milliseconds. Set this attribute to 0 in order to only refresh when new MIDI arrives in the third inlet (see list message). Defaults to 100ms.

c74object.discussion: bach.transcribe is note-based: each MIDI triplets refers to a note. If you want, a posteriori, to align notes into chords, you should look at bach.roll's merge message.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (list/llll)
